summary: The Pandemic Unemployment Fraud Enforcement Act amends the CARES Act to extend the statute of limitations for fraud related to unemployment programs. It extends the time frame for criminal prosecutions and civil enforcement actions to 10 years for violations related to Pandemic Unemployment Assistance, Federal Pandemic Unemployment Compensation, and Pandemic Emergency Unemployment Compensation. The bill also includes a provision for a $5,000,000 rescission from unobligated funds from a previous law. The amendments take effect upon enactment.
